definitions.text: a prominent or sensational but short-lived news event
examples: he made a great splash and then disappeared

definitions.text: a small quantity of something moist or liquid

examples: her red hat gave her outfit a splash of color

definitions.text: the act of splashing a (liquid) substance on a surface
the act of scattering water about haphazardly
cause (a liquid) to spatter about, especially with force
examples: She splashed the water around her
We had to splosh across the wet meadow

definitions.text: dash a liquid upon or against
examples: The mother splashed the baby's face with water

definitions.text: mark or overlay with patches of contrasting color or texture; cause to appear splashed or spattered
examples: The mountain was splashed with snow
water was splashing on the floor

definitions.text: soil or stain with a splashed liquid
strike and dash about in a liquid
examples: The boys splashed around in the pool
